availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard T. Whitaker (Shelby County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of J.S. Whitaker. Clerk in Shelby County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 6th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Second Lieutenant from to March 12, 1862. Served in the 6th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Major from March 12, 1863 to August 12, 1863. Served in the 6th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Lieutenant Colonel from August 12, 1863 to May 11, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 237.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 208.
